content: in the past few years i began the tradition of knitting a hat for each of my nieces and nephews for christmas each year i like to keep the pattern the same for everyone but choose different yarns to suit the likes of everyone s individual personalities i am always on the lookout for great unisex hat patterns that would work for any and every person and any and every yarn i wrote gatekeeper with this in mind it showcases ribbing throughout but with enough added interest to not only give the eye something to admire but also to keep me - the knitter - engaged and wanting to come back and knit it again and again gatekeeper comes in four sizes to choose from - but because the ribbing provides a lot of stretch you don t have to worry too much about guessing the correct size as each size could fit a variety of head sizes this is great news if you are knitting for a young one who is expected to grow or if you are knitting a gift and maybe you re not exactly sure of the measurements of the recipient s head pattern includes instructions for adjusting size and length it is both written and charted so you are able to work with your preferred method it has been fully tested and professionally tech edited sizes toddler child adult s adult l to fit head circumference 18 20 22 24 inches yarn approximately 100 120 140 160 yds of dk weight yarn shown in madelinetosh tosh dk dk weight 100% merino wool 225 yds / hank in a one of a kind speckled colorway * grey/white with orange speckles shown in adult l * unwind yarn company touring dk dk weight 100% merino wool 231 yds / 100 g in color mulled wine * red sample shown in adult s * madelinetosh tosh merino light fingering weight 100% merino wool 420 yds / hank in a one of a kind speckled colorway + rowan kidsilk haze lace weight 70% mohair 30% silk 229 yds / 25g in color 00600 dewberry * purple sample shown in toddler size * madelinetosh twist light fingering weight 75% merino wool 25% nylon 420 yds / hank in silver fox + fyberspates cumulus lace weight 74% alpaca 26% silk 164 yds / 25g in color silver green *pale blue sample shown in child size* needles 4 5mm/ us 7 circular i use 16 circulars but you can use a longer circular if you prefer the magic loop method 4 5mm/ us 7 dpn *or size needed to meet gauge * gauge 25 sts and 26 rounds = 4 knit in pattern in the round and measured after blocking notions stitch marker needle for weaving in ends skill level easy skills used knitting in the round k2tog ssk
